description: An electric motor too small for most vehicles, but just right for powering a bicycle.
A light-duty electrical motor, strong enough for an electric bicycle or scooter, but probably not practical for heavier vehicles.
A medium-duty electrical motor, suitable for powering ultra-light vehicles, or as part of a hybrid gas-electric drivetrain.
A heavy-duty electrical motor, capable of propelling a full-size car or SUV through electric power alone, provided you have the battery capacity.
A powerful high-performance electric motor, as found in those consumer electric sports cars with ridiculous, ludicrous, or similarly hyperbolic acceleration options.  It needs a lot of battery power.
A massive and extremely powerful electric motor, delivering high torque at the cost of significant power drain, this would be well suited to an electric racing car.
An enormous and heavy electric traction motor, powerful enough to pull a train.
